{{ja-kanjitab|かん|すう|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|cmn|ja|sort=かんすう}} {{m|cmn|函數|tr=hánshù||mathematical function}},<ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref> itself first used in print in 1859 in {{w|Li Shanlan}}'s {{etyl|zh|-}} translation of {{w|Elias Loomis}}'s ''Elements of Analytical Geometry and of the Differential and Integral Calculus''.

The Japanese reading of ''kansū'' is based on the expected Japanese [[音読み|on'yomi]] of the constituent characters.

The {{lang|ja|関数}} spelling is a replacement for the older {{ja-l|函数}} spelling, which was rendered [[obsolete]] when the {{ja-l|函}} character was excluded during formulation of the {{w|Tōyō kanji}} list.
